2132.subject: BUS
2132.descrlong: Examines venture formation and growth following completion of a business plan. Focuses on ongoing marketing, accounting, financial, and human resource management issues. Students examine startup and growth management issues faced by real-life ventures, and meet with entrepreneurs, and investors. Students also receive guidance on approaching potential sources of capital. (Offered only in Spring, as interest warrants; sections may be offered as classroom-based, hybrid, or online courses.)
